{{Han etym}}
Two {{zh-l|*丙}} side by side. {{och-l|丙}} was originally phonetic for {{och-l|兩}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{rfe|zh|are the two pronunciations etymologically related?}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{zh-l|二|two}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{hide box|Usage notes|align=left|
* In Beijing Mandarin, {{zh-l|兩}} is used when counting things with a measure word, {{zh-l|二}} is used in numbers.
** Examples with {{zh-l|兩}}
**: {{zh-x|兩 個 人|two people}}
**: {{zh-x|兩 年|two years}}
** Examples with {{zh-l|二}}
**: {{zh-x|二十|twenty (literally "two tens")}}
**: {{zh-x|第二|second}}}}
